overview: The purpose of this measure is to rename the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Office as the Broadband Office and transfer the Office from the Department of Business, Economic Development, and Tourism to the Department of Accounting and General Services (HB934_CD1). The measure also repeals the Broadband Assistance Advisory Council, establishes the Broadband Revolving Fund, and appropriates funds for contracts and to establish Digital Navigator positions (HB934_CD1). The effective date has been changed to July 1, 2025 (HB934_CD1).
appropriations: The legislative document specifies an appropriation of the sum of $200,000 (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 to be deposited into the broadband revolving fund (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt). It also inserts an appropriation amount of $800,000 (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt) out of the Broadband Revolving Fund for fiscal year 2025-2026 (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt) to fund and establish six full-time equivalent Digital Navigator positions (HB934_CD1). This sum is for the reimbursement of contracts executed by the broadband office (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt).
agency_impact: This measure amends the placement of the Broadband Office by "Establishing the Broadband Office within the Department of Accounting and General Services instead of specifically in the Office of Enterprise and Technology Services" (HB934_CD1). The bill clarifies that the office shall advise the Comptroller, instead of the Chief Information Officer, on broadband deployment (HB934_CD1). Furthermore, "expenditures from the Broadband Revolving Fund shall be made by the Broadband Office advised by the Information Technology Steering Committee and subject to prior approval by the Comptroller" (HB934_CD1).
policy_impact: This measure repeals the Broadband Assistance Advisory Council and renames the Hawaii Broadband and Digital Equity Office as the Broadband Office (HB934_CD1). A significant policy change is the transfer of the Office to the Department of Accounting and General Services (HB934_CD1). It also clarifies the oversight structure, making expenditures subject to prior approval by the Comptroller (HB934_CD1).
revenue_sources: This measure establishes the Broadband Revolving Fund as a new revenue source (HB934_CD1). For fiscal year 2025-2026, the legislative document specifies a deposit of $200,000 (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt) into the fund (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt).
six_year_fiscal_implications: With an effective date of July 1, 2025, the fiscal implications for fiscal year 2025-2026 are now specified (HB934_CD1). The legislative document specifies that the sum of $200,000 (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt) will be deposited into the newly established Broadband Revolving Fund (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt). Out of this fund, the legislative document specifies an appropriation amount of $800,000 (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt) for the reimbursement of contracts executed by the broadband office (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt). This funding is designated to "fund and establish six full-time equivalent Digital Navigator positions" (HB934_CD1).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The latest version of the bill inserts specific appropriation amounts, including $200,000 (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt) to be deposited into the newly established Broadband Revolving Fund and $800,000 (HB934_CD1_.HTM.txt) from the fund to establish six full-time equivalent Digital Navigator positions (HB934_CD1). A significant structural change moves the Broadband Office into the Department of Accounting and General Services, advising the Comptroller, who must provide prior approval for expenditures from the revolving fund (HB934_CD1). The measure also formally repeals the Broadband Assistance Advisory Council and changes the effective date to July 1, 2025 (HB934_CD1).
